item.title: Report X-2023090449
item.description:
Report X-2023090449

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was brough to the attention of the spill clean up specialist at our Phoenix AZ station location. Upon arriving to the station, it was seen during the course of travel package had become crushed and was slightly wet. Inspection of package found an all packed in one shipment consisting of UN 1866, UN 1769 and UN 2735. It is reported the metal can which was holding the UN 1866 leaked a small amount of resin causing the outer fibreboard box to become wet. Package was placed in a steel salvage drum and consignee was contacted to retrieve package from station location.

item.title: Report X-2023090258
item.description:
Report X-2023090258

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHEN I FOUND THIS PACKAGE IT WAS WET APON INSPECTION, I FOUND THAT ALL CAPOS WERE LOOSE NO SEALS WERE USED. DescribePack: THE FAILURE ACCURED WITH THE CAPS ALL CAPS WERE LOOSE NO SEALS WERE USED TO HOLD THEM IN PLACE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WHEN I FOUND THIS PACKAGE, I PLACED IT INTO A TOTE TO PREVENT OTHER PACKAGES FROM GETTING CONTAMINATED.

item.title: Report X-2023082071
item.description:
Report X-2023082071

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on van with wet on bottom and side, wrapped up in 2 plastic bags. Package was removed from van and placed inside of a hazmat plastic bag and then placed inside of a red hazmat tote. . DescribePack: 1 of the 4 bottles had a loose cap with a broken seal. The cap was re-tightened. There was no noticeable damage to the package besides it being wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed inside a hazmat bag, then folded closed and placed in a hazmat tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at QA area already damaged due to internal leakage from loose caps. DescribePack: Loose caps causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag and yellow drum.

item.title: Report X-2023082067
item.description:
Report X-2023082067

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was taken from the unload area wet due to the top of the internal container coming loose during shipment and leaking. when it was discovered the top was tightened down again and the entire contents were placed in a hazmat bag lined tote and taken to QA for processing DescribePack: the top of the plastic bottle came loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the bottle top was tightened down

item.title: Report X-2023081944
item.description:
Report X-2023081944

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leading up to the incident 2 hazmat's were sent up the belt, one was undamaged and one was damaged. The undamaged had some leakage from the other on the Botham of the box. Meanwhile the damaged hazmat had leakage coming from the inside DescribePack: There is a small puncture on one of the bottles holding the rapicide DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The damaged hazmat was put upside down to mitigate the spillage of the leaking contents

item.title: Report X-2023090251
item.description:
Report X-2023090251

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded when it was bumped off the rollers by another package being unloaded and fell onto the dock on the top part of the box causing one of the tops to become loose and leak DescribePack: One of the tops was loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the top was tightened down and the package was placed upright in a hazmat bag lined tote and taken to qa for processing

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PH was unloading and discovered leaking hazmat during AM sort DescribePack: Loose cap caused product to leak internally and externally DurationRel: 22 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was discovered QA was called to handle and put in hazmat tote to transport to QA

item.title: Report X-2023081947
item.description:
Report X-2023081947

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was being unloaded when it was discovered that one side of the box was wet and torn due to at least one leaking bottle top. The liquid damaged the box front so much that the box couldn't contain the other 3 gallons of liquid which have apparently fallen out of the box along the route to the QA area. When the box was discovered, it was brought to the QA area in a hazmat bag lined tote to be processed. DescribePack: There is a very large hole in the front panel of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The lid was tightened on the bottle.
